subject: Cybersecurity
title: Data Breach Notification Laws: The Clock Is Ticking
description: One-minute skill: Data Breach Notification Laws: The Clock Is Ticking.

hook.text: Equifax discovered its breach in July 2017 but didn't notify the public until September. 143 million people waited.

buildup.text: Breach notification laws require organizations to inform affected individuals and regulators within specific.

discovery.text: GDPR requires notification within 72 hours. US laws vary by state ‚Äì from 30 to 90 days. Some countries have.

twist.text: Uber hid a 2016 breach affecting 57 million users for over a year. They paid hackers $100,000 to delete the stolen data.

climax.text: Notification laws exist because companies have incentives to hide breaches. Disclosure hurts stock prices.

punchline.text: Uber paid hackers to keep quiet. The cover-up cost more than the breach.

quiz.question: How long does GDPR require organizations to report a data breach?
